Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes an issue introduced by #8906 

The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Dapper_Release Notes_ScreenReader: On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference" (#9061) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468978

**Actual:**
On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty if link is not announced descriptively.

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: [https://www.nuget.org/packages/Dapper/](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fwww.nuget.org%2f&data=04%7c01%7cv-prajadhav%40microsoft.com%7cf2a4ca1fba7e473d451608d9a59e03f4%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637722920825871875%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c1000&sdata=OWWbKuc497S8l6rMh9v0D4GOq3rSkwlcss0RW8CyFkk%3D&reserved=0)
2. "Dapper" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Release Notes' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Run the NVDA
5. Check that screen reader is announcing the link inside 'Release Notes' tab.

### Expected Behavior

The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Microsoft.Identity.Client_ScreenReader:When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table the screen reader is not announcing the column headers name when its read the cell data" (#9048) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468943

**Actual:**
When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table and move to each cell the column header of the respective cell is not read
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in throughout the application

**Expected:**
Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty in knowing the column header reference of the cell

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2. "Microsoft.Identity.Client" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Used by' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Tab to 'NuGet packages' table.
5. Run the NVDA
6. tab to the cells of the table   

### Expected Behavior

Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Account_ForgotPassword_Keyboard :Invisible content receives focus when user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key." (#9052) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468987

**Actual:**
Invisible content receives focus  when the user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key.

**Expected:**
There tab focus from edit field should move to  send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will receive correct focus order 

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword
2. "Forgot Password" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Email' edit field and fill it.
4. Tab to send button and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

There tab focus from edit field should move to send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_coverlet.msbuild_Tab Navigation_Keyboard : Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key." (#9068) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468923

**Actual:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key.
On using tab to a "tab" item the focus on next tab key moves to the next item rather then the data under it
Similar issue is observed for the tab list including 'Readme' , 'Dependencies' , 'Used by' and 'Version'.
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will not be able to access the data under tabs immediately 

### Repro Steps

1.  Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2.  "coverlet.msbuild" page will get open.
3.  Tab to Tab navigation controls.
4.  Tab to Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Made Package Details page's tabs navigable with left/right arrow keys" (#9077) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/9068

**Problem:**
 
On the Package Details page, tabs are navigated between using the tab key, rather than the left and right arrow keys, as it is supposed to be. This means that once a user has selected a tab, they must still tab navigate through the remaining inactive tabs before they can access the tab content.

**Previously,**
![20220325_182528](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/160219270-24b3d6af-42ae-484e-a867-cbae22dbc822.gif)

**Fix:**

I added an event listener for left and right arrow keys, and changed the tab in focus based on the input. I used keyUp as the trigger here rather than keyDown, because adding an event listener for keyDown also messed with other keyboard functionality (eg. 'tab' and 'enter' keys) when focused on the tab element.

To enable this, I also made it such that only the selected/expanded tab has _tabindex="0"_ and receives tab focus sequentially with other elements on the page, while all inactive tabs have _tabindex="-1"_, and can only receive focus when using left/right arrow keys from their active sibling tab. Once a new tab is made active, we set _tabindex="-1"_ on the previous tab, and _tabindex="0"_ on the new active tab.

**After the changes,**
![20220325_181409](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/160219028-f8bd7c95-7efc-410a-8d32-3140726d749d.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y]Enable dismissing Verified tooltip with esc" (#9074) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, when navigated to by keyboard, the verified tooltip cannot be dismissed without tabbing away from the icon.
This change enables dismissing this tooltip by usage of the esc key for all locations where this tooltip is used.

As a bonus it also fixes a bug that could cause the tooltip to stop working altogether when clicked on.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reduce the amount of magic numbers in JS code in Gallery" (#9078) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Gallery JS code is ridden with magic numbers:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L12

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L244

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/common.js#L574-L578

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/autocomplete.js#L64-L67

etc.

For better code readability it would be nice to provide nice names at least for some of them (key codes, for example). Some attempts to do it seems to have been done in the past, we need to extend it:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/6136fc988f19595bf1bbf96d0be7343e77e1a31a/src/NuGetGallery/Scripts/gallery/autocomplete.js#L3-L13

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Duplicate PackageReference includes are handled inconsistently by all restores, leading to unnecessary full restores" (#9864) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Take a project such as the following: 

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net5.0</TargetFramework>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="NuGet.Protocol" Version="5.5.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="NuGet.Protocol" Version="5.6.0" />
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

Note the duplicate PackageReference declaration. Digging further reveals that different project types and different tools handle it differently. 

See the below table for details

| Restore Flavor | PackageReference declaration | 
| - | - |
| Commandline restore (all) | First |
| Static graph restore (all) | First | 
| VS - SDK based projects | Last |
| VS - Legacy PR projects | First |

This leads to issues as the ones described in https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/issues/5550 (see below repro). 

I think logically from an msbuild perspective, we'd expect that the last value is the one that's resolved. This needs investigated and ideally consolidated. 
Note that consolidating VS - LEgacy PR projects might be impossible, due to the fact that it's largely in maintenance mode.

See repro below.

cc folks that might have some thoughts around: 

@jeffkl @davkean @dsplaisted @zivkan 

fyi @sharwell @garath

[DuplicateIds.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5002828/DuplicateIds.zip)

**WIP**: 
**Design**: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/compare/dev-nkolev92-duplicatesHandling 
**Implementation**: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/tree/dev-nkolev92-duplicatePRs

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unexpected error “Your project file doesn’t list ‘win’ as a “RuntimeIdentifier”” occurs when building the solution after enabling “RestoreLockedMode”" (#10590) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.10.0.7140
VS Version: Main\31021.18 
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-20h1

## Repro steps and/or sample project

1. Create a C# Class Library (.NET Framework) project via VS. 
2. Install a few ‘PackageReference’ packages into the projects.
3. Set MSBuild property “RestorePackagesWithLockFile” to true in csproj file.
 ` <RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>`
4. Do a restore.
5. Check it should have generated ‘packages.lock.json’ file alongside *.csproj file.
6. Set msbuild property “RestoreLockedMode” to “true”.
    `<RestoreLockedMode>true</RestoreLockedMode>`
7. Install another package.
8. It should still work fine and update ‘packages.lock.json’ file.
9. Manually add a new PackageReference item into csproj file.
```
<PackageReference Include="NUnit">
      <Version>3.12.0</Version>
    </PackageReference>
```
10. Perform restore.
11. Build the solution.

## Expected

Only expected error NU1004 shows on error list when building the solution.

## Actual

Unexpected error “Your project file doesn’t list ‘win’ as a “RuntimeIdentifier”” occurs when building the solution as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/108685454-20d9f600-752f-11eb-949a-96aa2699b17f.png)

## Notes

1. This issue  doesn’t repro on .NET Core projects.
2.  The issue starts from Dev\5.9.0.7086.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Duplicated resource strings between NuGet.CommandLine.Xplat and NuGet.Commands" (#3380) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are some strings duplicated between two resource files. This can potentially lead to wasted localization effort. My hunch is that some are unused (probably the Xplat ones):

I found these so far:

```
Error_MissingSourceParameter    Source parameter was not specified. 
Log_Committing  Committing restore...   
Log_FoundProjectRoot    Found project root directory: {0}.  
Log_LoadedProject   Loaded project {0} from {1}.    
Log_RunningNonParallelRestore   Running non-parallel restore.   
Log_RunningParallelRestore  Running restore with {0} concurrent jobs.   
Log_UsingPackagesDirectory  Using packages directory: {0}.  
NuGetDocs   http://docs.nuget.org/  
```

We should think about a way to detect unused resource strings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Disable ExtractPackageAsync_RepositoryPrimarySignedPackage_PackageSignedWithCertFromRepositoryAllowList_SuccessAsync " (#11701) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Disable NuGet.CommandLine.Test.NuGetPushCommandTest.PushCommand_PushToServer_WhenPluginReturnsNoCredentials_FallBackToConsoleProvider" (#11705) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[Bug]: new warning for package source mappings doesn't pass a value for the resource string placeholder" (#11709) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 17.2.0-preview-22178-03+1160f4e0e for .NET Framework

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Updated to a VS build containing #11505.  Someone on my team started seeing this error (because we have Warnings As Errors, it broke the build):

> error NU1507: There are {0} package sources defined in your configuration. When using central package management, please map your package sources with package source mapping (https://aka.ms/nuget-package-source-mapping) or specify a single package source. [d:\dd\WebTools\WebTools.sln]

Note: the string still has {0} because it doesn't pass a value to the placeholder.  [Source](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/b30bcfb30ffa5d6fad591737fe6055b6ff6d01b7/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Commands/RestoreCommand/RestoreCommand.cs#L476)

Additional comments:
* Our nuget.config only has a single source.  We're perplexed about why we're even getting this warning.  Maybe some additional info about which feeds are being detected would also be helpful?  NuGet.config contents:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="WebTools VSTS Feed" value="https://devdiv.pkgs.visualstudio.com/...snip..." />
  </packageSources>

  <!-- Don't let user disabled sources in VS prevent us from restoring -->
  <disabledPackageSources>
    <clear />
  </disabledPackageSources>
</configuration>
```
* This isn't happening consistently.  I couldn't repro on my machine, same VS build, same repo. 🤷‍♂️ There may be something different in our environments, but the message isn't helpful for us to figure out what.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Add support for alternative ZIP-compatible compression schemes in nuget" (#11706) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe, NuGet SDK

### The Elevator Pitch

Nugets are getting bigger and bigger, but they keep using the standard `zlib` compression of their contents.  However, the ZIP standard allows for alternative compressions (see section [4.4.3 here](https://pkware.cachefly.net/webdocs/casestudies/APPNOTE.TXT)), with libraries like [`libzip`](https://libzip.org/) (and its managed wrapper [`LibZipSharp`](https://github.com/xamarin/LibZipSharp/)) or the 7z SDK supporting all of the additional compression algorithms.  If support for them (`lzma` or `bzip2`) would be added to NuGet, the system would remain compatible with the existing nuget compression but would allow for creation of new nugets which
use the other compression schemes, benefiting users as far as download times and disk space are concerned.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: A prompt error “cannot access disposed object” prevents solution saving after installing a package from local path" (#11703) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.2.0.132

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32329.175
NuGet Version: Dev\6.2.0.132
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2

### Repro steps:
1.Only enable one package source which point to local path (have some packages) in the Options->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources.
2.Create a C# Console App (.NET Core 6.0) project in VS.
3.Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window, select ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’ and select the package source (which I set in step1) in the Package source drop-down box.
4.Click “Browse” tab and install a package from the local path.
5.Save the solution and close VS.

### Expected:
The solution can be saved and closed successfully.

### Actual:
A prompt error “cannot access disposed object” prevents solution saving after installing a package from local path as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/160847414-e8cc9efa-e410-4a29-9a87-9b672aa87f38.png)
### Notes:
1.It reproes on .NET SDK style projects, does not repro on .NET Framework projects.
2.It just repro on local path packages, dose not repro on online package source (e.g. nuget.org).
3.It start to repro from Dev\6.2.0.132, doesn't repro on Dev\6.2.0.131.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
